page.title: 08RENFREW GALA WEEK
page.content: Renfrew Gala Week is normally held in the first week in June and is coordinated by the Community Council. One of the first events is the Junior Miss Renfrew Contest organised by Renfrew High School. Contestants come from Primary 7 and Secondary 1 and 2. The winner is the Gala Queen whose duties include heading the Gala Parade and opening the Babcock Fete. Other events are a Pet Show, a Girl Guide Gang Show, a Badminton Competition, a Five-a Side Football Competition, a Bowling Competition, a Swimming Gala, and a "Scouterama"held by local Scouts. The library organises competitions and the YMCA organise a very popular 'Fun Run' covering 10 miles and involving nearly 300 runners. The closing event is the Gala Dance organised by the Community Council.
